{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2956752,"name":"Bhavreet Brar","username":"Bhavreet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhavreet/{size}/154161_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-03T19:27:32.549Z","cooked":"

We were using this motor to run our shooter, and it was on a 3:1 gear ratio. It is a year old, but was not used much last year because of COVID.

Image from iOS3024×4032 351 KB

Nothing a little duct tape can’t fix… But more seriously. What gearbox was it in? Looks like a vex planetary gearbox. We had problems with our neo 550 planetary gearbox on our intake the set screw came loose multiple times. I think we put loctite on the setscrew.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2021-06-03T19:46:29.549Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":299,"readers_count":298,"score":69.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":394409,"topic_slug":"motor-shaft-is-stripped","display_username":"Cameron (Advanced Programmer)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35092,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motor-shaft-is-stripped/394409/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2956760,"name":"Bhavreet Brar","username":"Bhavreet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhavreet/{size}/154161_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-03T19:54:03.244Z","cooked":"

we used a vex vp. The problem seems to be with the pinion, as it was shredding the motor shaft down, as seen in the picture. Is it possible we were simply missing a piece to keep it in place, as all we have been doing is putting the pinion over the shaft, and then putting the female output that connects to the vp on top of that and tightening it.

Failing NEO 550 in VersaPlanetary Gearboxes Technical Discussion
Our team runs two NEO 550s in VPs, one for our intake and one for our colour wheel mechanism. Both experience the issue of the VP motor shaft clamp loosening from the motor shaft and causing slight damage to the shaft, presumably as it free spins. The damage got so bad on the intake that the motor had to be swapped out. We have tried tightening the crib screw alot, locktight and aryldite epoxy but it always finds its way loose in anywhere from 3-30 minutes of runtime (best results with epoxy). …

See this thread. We had the same issue.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2021-06-03T21:21:37.863Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":250,"readers_count":249,"score":85.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":394409,"topic_slug":"motor-shaft-is-stripped","display_username":"James Kirby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/failing-neo-550-in-versaplanetary-gearboxes/393512","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Failing NEO 550 in VersaPlanetary Gearboxes","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40772,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/motor-shaft-is-stripped/394409/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2956804,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-04T00:49:15.976Z","cooked":"
Bhavreet:

Is it possible we were simply missing a piece to keep it in place, as all we have been doing is putting the pinion over the shaft

When you say pinion do you mean input coupler?

What color tablecloth do you have at your Versaplanetary assembly station? Ours is yellow.

Yeah he means the input coupler

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2021-06-06T02:37:50.886Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":146,"readers_count":145,"score":34.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":394409,"topic_slug":"motor-shaft-is-stripped","display_username":"risho900","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4999,"username":"Nate_Laverdure","name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32742,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/motor-shaft-is-stripped/394409/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957091,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-06-06T09:50:13.599Z","cooked":"

One thing to check that’s easy to miss: when you slide the input coupler onto the motor coupler, make sure the groove in the two parts are aligned with each other. This ensures that when you are tightening the set screw, the motor coupler acts like a clamp and closes onto the shaft.
